intro: Rytigynia adenodonta var. reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate rytigynia, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive reticulate pattern on the underside. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical and subtropical regions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
